content.description: Start on the large sidepull jug. Climb up the arete using cool jugs and compressions.
content.location: The first boulder you encounter after crossing the granite dome clearing when approaching from the "Slippery Rocks"

content.description: Start on the right most jug and traverse left before finding a high foot and standing up on the large rail. Move up finding higher feet and slopers near the top. There is a big left and right hand jug that can be used for the top out. A heady problem for the grade. Crux is near the top.
content.location: Following the dam pathway towards Slippery rocks, take a left after passing by the exposed rock in the path. Follow the small trail up a slopey clearing until you find a trail to the right. Follow this trail as it curves left until you see a stone staircase. This problem is to the left of that staircase directly left of Couple's Retreat.If coming from Singing Sands, follow the trail and take a left by Chutebacca. Continue through the clearing. This problem will be on the left before the stone staircase.

content.description: A close to the ground boulder that can be done with your sleeping pad. Traverse right, starting with hands matched on the left most pedestal. Do some cool moves to avoid the wet and dirty feet. Finish by stepping onto the small boulder.
content.location: Get to the highest point by going to slippery rock and taking a hard left. Follow path to the top of the hill. Look down the rocks to find this bad boy.

content.description: Start the same as EZ Traverse. Find your way to a stance right above the ground and go for the top out.
Stand start with left hand crimp and right hand on prominent side pull. Climb up the bulge using good holds and compression then topout.
content.location: After crossing the dam, continue on the trail towards slippery rock. There will be slopey rocks on the trail, and take an immediate left right after these rocks on a small trail. Continue on the trail as it trends left, which should take you right to the problem. If at Chutbacca, continue right around the outcrop until reaching this boulder on your left.

content.description: Climb the middle of the wall using the two cracks.
content.location: From the dam parking, walk the trail into the woods. Keep left at the fork. Follow the trail down and take the first right. The wall is on the right.

content.description: Across the dam there is another large outcropping, which has not seen much development. There is definitely potential for awesome boulders here, but most will require a ton of cleaning and "downed tree management."
